Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state A, $P_A = 1 \times 10^5 P_a$ and $V_A = 3 L$
Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state B, $P_B = 1 \times 10^5 P_a$ and $V_B = 4 L$
According to the ideal gas equation of state $\frac{P_{B}V_{B}}{T_{B}}=\frac{P_{A}V_{A}}{T_{A}}$, $T_{B} = 400 \mathrm{K}$ can be obtained
